comment: Dr. Lee is honestly one of the worst professors I've ever taken. She spends most of class time telling personal stories that don't relate to class. She is so scatter brain; most of the assignments didn't have clear instructions or a clear due date. She told her two classes different things all the time. Sends emails around midnight. DO NOT TAKE!

Dr. Lee had no clue what was going on in the course. She never had clear expectations for any assignment or clear instructions. She grades extremely harshly on things that don't matter and there's no way to know what she wants. She never grades in a timely manner and only sends out emails at midnight. Every lecture was just her telling stories.

Dr. Lee will tell you 3 different due dates for a single assignment, and then ask you to complete it in 3 different ways. Her directions were always unclear, and we all spent most of the semester confused. She had every assignment and module handed to her by the department and Im not convinced she ever read them until the day we did them.

Dr. Lee started the class by sending an email saying she was "absolutely devastated" that we did not turn in an information sheet on time. She was all over the place in her grading and expectations and everyone was confused. She blames every other professor in her department for her teaching and technological issues. It was incredibly frustrating.

Dr.Lee is an amazing teacher!!! I highly recommend her if you are seriously interested in the education field. The course load(modules)is heavy but as you as long complete the readings you will do great. She very experienced and passionate about what she dose and  there's never a dull moment in her class. She also always available to her students.

Dr. Lee is a nice and helpful professor. She has tons of great advice, and loves student input. She grades a bit harshly and WILL deduct points for grammatical errors in your assignments. One of the funnest classes I've taken at KSU so far...I'm a Biology Ed. major :)

Took the hybrid class, which sometimes cut the time to include all of Dr. Lee's stories and the necessary classwork. She was sometimes unspecific about what she wanted in assignments, but very strict in grading. KNOW THE WRITING CONVENTIONS. That aside, Dr. Lee is a great person to learn about educ and how things work.

Dr. Lee is such an experienced professor that knows what she is doing. She is a little scattered brain at times. There are a lot of modules and a lot of work but if you want to be a teacher it is worth it.

I ended up taking the hybrid version of this class and it was amazing. Dr. Lee is a great professor, offers extra credit, and her assignments are clearly presented. Do your work and participate in class and you'll make an easy A. Loved, loved, loved this course.

Was confused the entire semester.  Dr. Lee wasn't sure what she wanted out of this class, never got set dates, one class dhe may say she wants a group project one way and by next class she changes her mind.  Has wonderful stories, but she doesn't give good feedback, it is always negative and not helpful.  Doesn't explain her grading on projects.
She was a great professor. She loves group work! She has tons of stories and advice. She is very interested in what she is teaching.
